doc.field: Kane-Greenberg collection of cigar label proofs
Kane-Greenberg collection of cigar label proofs

The Kane-Greenberg Collection of Cigar Label Proofs spans the period from ca. 1890 to ca. 1930 and contains progressive chromolithograph proof books for cigar box labels. These proofs were used to check color quality. Brands from most of the major cigar companies of the time period are represented in the collection. The collection provides a wealth of material for studying the various American advertising themes and iconographic motifs used in the promotion and marketing of a single product. The books are arranged by the letter and number codes printed on them by Consolidated.
Gift of Raymond Kane, Stanley Greenberg, Neil Greenberg, and Morris Greenberg, 1983.
